title: Exam: Professional Ethics & CSR
description: Assessment of administrative ethics, CSR frameworks, and advanced reporting structures.

items.prompt: What is the primary definition of 'Whistleblowing'?
options: Reporting illegal or unethical activities within an organisation
items.explanation: Whistleblowing involves reporting internal misconduct to authorities or management.

items.prompt: The CEO ________ (refuse / comment) on the allegations of fraud during the press conference.
items.explanation: Refuse + to-infinitive.

items.prompt: A 'Conflict of Interest' occurs when ______.
options: Two departments share the same budget
A person's private interests interfere with their professional duties
A company opens a new branch abroad
Employees disagree on the office temperature
items.explanation: Conflicts of interest compromise professional objectivity.

items.prompt: The auditors suggested ________ (review) the internal control system immediately.
items.explanation: Suggest + gerund (-ing).

items.prompt: Which dimension is NOT part of the Triple Bottom Line (TBL)?
items.explanation: The TBL focus is on People, Profit, and Planet.

items.prompt: It is widely ________ (rumour) that the company is considering a merger.
items.explanation: Passive reporting: It is + past participle.

items.prompt: To 'adhere to' a code of conduct means to ______.
items.explanation: Adherence refers to strict compliance.

items.prompt: The manager denied ________ (leak) the confidential documents to the press.
items.explanation: Deny + gerund (-ing).

items.prompt: In a DEI context, 'Equity' refers to ______.
options: Ensuring processes are impartial and provide equal possible outcomes
The total value of company shares
Hiring only from one specific demographic
items.explanation: Equity focuses on fairness and equal outcomes, not just equal treatment.

items.prompt: The board ________ (promise / increase) transparency in the next financial report.
items.explanation: Promise + to-infinitive.

items.prompt: What is an 'Ethical Audit'?
options: A check of the company's bank accounts
An evaluation of an organisation's ethical performance
items.explanation: Ethical audits assess compliance with ethical standards.

items.prompt: The project is expected ________ (finish) by the end of the month.
items.explanation: Subject + passive verb + to-infinitive.

items.prompt: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles is ______.
items.explanation: Integrity is a core value in professional ethics.

items.prompt: It has been ________ (agree) that the audit will begin on Monday.
items.explanation: It + passive verb (perfect) + that clause.

items.prompt: What does CSR stand for?
items.explanation: CSR is the integration of social/environmental concerns into business.

items.prompt: He is said ________ (leave) the company due to a conflict of interest.
items.explanation: Personal passive for past events (to have + past participle).

items.prompt: A 'Stakeholder' is someone who ______.
options: Has an interest or concern in an organisation
items.explanation: Stakeholders include employees, customers, shareholders, and the community.

items.prompt: The consultant recommended ________ (conduct) a thorough risk assessment.
items.explanation: Recommend + gerund (-ing).

items.prompt: To 'mitigate damage' means to ______.
options: Reduce the severity or impact of something negative
items.explanation: Mitigation aims to minimize negative consequences.

items.prompt: They are required ________ (sign) the new code of conduct by Friday.
items.explanation: Are required + to-infinitive.
